column4: is there something in the rules that forbids asking about ndiswrapper?
well i've been asking about it forever
i'm following the tutorial on https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SetupNdiswrapperHowto but i ran into a problem with the .deb files
dpkg -i --force-overwrite ndiswrapper-modules-$(uname -r)_1.1-1_i386.deb this command does not work
uhh let me back up a second
i downloaded ndiswrapper then followed the instructions. after i did a dpkg -i --force-overwrite ndiswrapper-utils_1.6-1_i386.deb that worked
this is the error from make deb "/usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.12-9-386/scripts/gcc-version.sh: line 11: gcc-3.4: command not found
do you have gcc-3.4 installed? the default (4.0) may not do
better yet - set export CC=`which gcc`
nope, as long is this isn't a kernel compile, just 'export CC=`which gcc`' - and then make .... - give it a go
the version of gcc that i have is  4.0.2 20050808
well try setting CC to your path to gcc, or install gcc3.4 - your call but I have to blow - gl
